sentence.Network_en: It's an affront to human dignity to keep someone alive like this.
sentence.Network_cn: 如此维持一个人的生命是对人类尊严的冒犯。

sentence.Network_en: She has taken my enquiry as a personal affront.
sentence.Network_cn: 她将我的询问当成了人身侮辱。

sentence.Network_en: He took his son's desertion as a personal affront.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把儿子的离开看作是对他个人的侮辱.

PerfectNetExp.abs: GRE 词汇表(红宝书) - 豆丁网 ... affliction n． 痛苦，折磨 affront v． 侮辱，冒犯 aftermath n． 不幸事件之后果，余波.
GRE 词汇表(红宝书) - 豆丁网 ... affliction n． 痛苦，折磨 affront v． 侮辱，冒犯 aftermath n． 不幸事件之后果，余波.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(A) ... affright 惊吓 affront 公开侮辱 affronted 被侮辱的.
大学英语精读第五册 Unit 3_在线英语听力室 ... premise 前提；假设 affront 当众侮辱，有意冒犯 heretofore 迄今为止；在此之前.

list.abs: his speech was an affront to all members of the community ., 他的话对社区所有成员是故意的侮辱.
and " an affront others or fabricating facts to slander others , " and other circumstances ., 及 " 公然侮辱他人或者捏造事实诽谤他人 " 等情形.
how to affront risk of chinese abroad project enterprise in the financial crisis ., 金融危机中我国境外工程企业如何面对风险.
It ' s a personal affront to me and every member of our congress ., 这对我和对我们会议的全体人员都是一种人身侮辱.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (as a verb): from Old French afronter 'to slap in the face, insult', based on Latin ad frontem 'to the face'

entry.def: If something affronts you, you feel insulted and hurt because of it.

example.tran: 让卡斯帕罗夫感到特别受辱的一件事

entry.def: If something is an affront to you, it is an obvious insult to you.

example.ex: It's an affront to human dignity to keep someone alive like this...
example.tran: 如此维持一个人的生命是对人类尊严的冒犯。

example.ex: She has taken my enquiry as a personal affront.
example.tran: 她将我的询问当成了人身侮辱。

means.word_mean: 1. a deliberately offensive act or something producing the effect of an affront;

sentences.sentence: "turning his back on me was a deliberate insult"

means.word_mean: 1. treat, mention, or speak to rudely;

sentences.sentence: "He insulted her with his rude remarks"
"the student who had betrayed his classmate was dissed by everyone"

auth_sentence.content: But "empty eloquence" can also be an affront.
auth_sentence.res_content: But "empty eloquence" can also be an affront.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But "empty eloquence" can also be an affront.

auth_sentence.content: It's a personal affront to me, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's a personal affront to me, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's a personal affront to me, he said.

auth_sentence.content: The banner protested an affront to the millennium-old Mapuche culture.
auth_sentence.res_content: The banner protested an affront to the millennium-old Mapuche culture.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The banner protested an affront to the millennium-old Mapuche culture.

sentences.en: His refusal to see me was an affront.
sentences.cn: 他拒绝见我, 这对我是个侮辱。

sentences.en: He took his son’s desertion as a personal affront.
sentences.cn: 他把儿子的离开看作是对他个人的侮辱。

sentences.en: It was an affront to common decency
sentences.cn: 这是对社会礼仪的公然冒犯。

sentences.en: Your behaviour is an affront to public decency.
This remark caused affront to many people.
I was affronted by his actions.
